intro: Ophryosporus bipinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved burrweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, spiny fruits that enclose the seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its ability to thrive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Ophryosporus bipinnatifidus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
